7392048_syn_1:
Procedure: Robotic Bronchoscopy (Ion).
- Target: 2.7cm RUL nodule.
- Nav + REBUS confirmed.
- TBBx x7, Brush x3, Wash.
- ROSE: Squamous malignancy.
7392048_syn_2: Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy was performed utilizing the Ion robotic platform to target a spiculated RUL nodule. Radial EBUS confirmed concentric probe placement. Transbronchial biopsies and brushings yielded a diagnosis of squamous cell carcinoma on rapid on-site evaluation.
7392048_syn_3: Codes: 31628 (Lung biopsy), 31627 (Nav add-on), 31654 (REBUS add-on), 31624 (BAL). 31623 bundled. Robotic platform used for navigation to peripheral RUL lesion (2.7cm).
7392048_syn_4:
Procedure:
1. Ion catheter setup.
2. Registration (7 points).
3. Nav to RUL posterior seg.
4. REBUS confirmation.
5. Sampling (Forceps/Brush/Wash).
6. ROSE positive.
7392048_syn_5: robotic bronch for that rul spot navigated right to it rebus showed solid lesion got good bites rose called it squamous right away patient did great no bleeding.
7392048_syn_6: Ion robotic navigational bronchoscopy was performed for a 2.7 cm RUL nodule. Radial EBUS confirmed the target. Forceps biopsies, brushings, and washings were obtained. ROSE confirmed squamous malignancy.
7392048_syn_7:
[Indication]
RUL nodule, suspect malignancy.
[Anesthesia]
General.
[Description]
Ion robotic navigation. REBUS confirm. TBBx/Brush/BAL.
[Plan]
Staging, Tumor board.
7392048_syn_8: We used the Ion robot to navigate to [REDACTED]. Once we reached the spot in the right upper lobe, we used ultrasound to confirm we were in the lesion. We took several samples, and the pathologist in the room confirmed it was cancer.
7392048_syn_9: We utilized the robotic platform to localize the RUL lesion. Radial EBUS verified the position. We acquired tissue via forceps and brush. The rapid evaluation indicated malignancy.
7392048:
Bronch Procedure Summary

Pt: [REDACTED] | 58M | MRN: [REDACTED]
DOS: [REDACTED]
MD: Julia Ramirez (attending) + Tom Sanders (fellow)

**Why:** RUL nodule, 2.7cm, spiculated, SUV 7.2, heavy smoker

**What we did:** EMN bronch, radial EBUS, TBBx

**How it went:**

Used superDimension system. CT from 3/14 loaded. Target = RUL posterior segment.

Auto-registration done - looked good, 7 points matched.

Navigated to target with locatable guide. Got to about 6mm from target per system.

REBUS showed concentric pattern, lesion ~25mm, irregular margins, solid appearance.

Biopsied through guide sheath:
- 7 forceps biopsies (good tissue each time)
- 3 brushings
- Washing for micro + cyto

ROSE = Dr. Park says "definite malignancy, squamous features"

No bleeding. Patient did great. CXR ordered.

**Specimens:**
- TBBx x7 → path (formalin)
- Brushings x3 → cyto
- Washing → micro/cyto

**Next steps:**
Stage (brain MRI, confirm PET covers everything), tumor board, likely surgery candidate given isolated RUL lesion, good PFTs. F/u 1 wk.

J. Ramirez MD
